channel.title: Help!
channel.description: Ok so i am brand new to photoshop and i am very confused with things...I know i will get flamed to hell with this and everyones gonna say u suck! and other stuff...But i am not too sure what a render is.. i want to know becuase aparently that is a main thing...So if anyone can give me a tip on what that is and any other basic things it will be highly apreciated!!!!!

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @slinkyman24 slinkyman24
item.description:
@slinkyman24 wrote:

Ok thanks for your help…When i put a rendor into a graphic do i need to do that color range thing? or something or is there some tool im missing[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 09, 2008, 05:36:34 PM[/size][hr]so how should i add a rendor to my picture?

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @javis javis
item.description:
@javis wrote:

A render is the “focal” or attention getter of your graphic. You do not need a render to make a graphic. Also a graphic isnt just about the render. A graphic/signature/tag its just a piece of art that you make that you personally think looks good or in some cases doesnt. Since your new i would recomend learning the interface or functions of photoshop. I will get you a link
http://graphicssoft.about.com/od/pselementsbasics/Photoshop_Elements_Basic_Tutorials.htm

At that link you can learn what all the photo shop tools do and how to use them.

http://www.11amdesign.com/faq/index.php?sid=141703&lang=en&action=artikel&cat=1&id=343&artlang=en

At that link you can learn some cool tips and tricks for beginners using photoshop

After you have done that you can begin reading tutorials on ho wto create graphics. Most tutorials are rates by how how hard they are. Ill get you some links to some beginner ones.

Blending tutorial. The brushes that he talks about you can find at Deviantart.com
Same type of tutorial different outcome
http://forums.filefront.com/tutorials-questions/257617-ncols-newbie-friendly-tutorials.html

You can go here and find some decent tutorials. Im not sure how difficult they are.
http://planetrenders.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=69649

Heres a link to find some resources for your photoshop
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,248912.0.html

You can find tons of renders here just by looking through their gallerys
http://planetrenders.net/renders/

If you need any more help feal free to ask. Although i use gimp and not photoshop ill try to help you the best i can

Read full topic
